info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 12:49AM CDT until June 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following counties, Greeley and Valley.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring along Highway 11 near North Loup. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Highway 11 near North Loup is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Shepherd Creek, Davis Creek, Hays Creek, Clear Creek, Messenger Creek, Cedar River, Elm Creek, Spring Creek, Stewart Creek, Wallace Creek and Mira Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scotia and North Loup.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING
